title: House Panel Releases Documents From Nixon Tax Case Amid Trump Tax Dispute
summary: Documents show IRS turned over Nixon documents to Congress upon request. WASHINGTON-The House Ways and Means Committee released decades-old correspondence between Congress and the Internal Revenue Service about the investigation of President Nixon's tax returns, as Democrats try to bolster their case for getting President Trump's tax returns.

title: Jeweler Alex & Ani Fights $50 Million Bank of America Default
summary: Jewelry retailer files lawsuit challenging default on $50 million credit facility. Alex & Ani LLC is fighting Bank of America 's claim that the jewelry retailer defaulted on a $50 million credit facility, filing a lawsuit accusing the lender of gender discrimination.

title: House Approves Debt-Ceiling Bill Despite GOP Dissent
summary: Many Republican members objected to the Trump-backed bill, citing fears about the U.S. deficit. WASHINGTON-The House passed a two-year spending agreement that also lifts the government's borrowing limit, advancing the compromise over the concerns of many conservatives who had urged President Trump to reject it.

title: Amazon's Streak of Record Profit Ends
summary: Shipping costs and a steeper loss in its overseas retail business weigh on earnings. Amazon.com Inc.'s record quarterly profit streak has ended, as the online retailer faced higher shipping costs, slowing growth from its cloud-computing business and a steeper loss in its overseas retail business.

title: Beyond Mueller's 'Purview'
summary: The Justice Department will have to examine the rest of the Russia story.. Having failed to prove collusion and obstruction of justice, the cheerleaders of the Robert Mueller investigation are now highlighting his claim this week that Russia is still trying to interfere in U.S. elections. No doubt the Russians are. Which makes it all the more important that the Justice Department finish the half of the Russian-meddling probe that Mr. Mueller didn't.

title: A Prince's $500 Billion Desert Dream: Flying Cars, Robot Dinosaurs and a Giant Artificial Moon
summary: Resume Subscription. SHARMA, Saudi Arabia-This seaside corner of northwest Saudi Arabia is so barren that the only abundant resources a group of consultants could identify were sunlight and "unlimited access to salt water."

title: Mariano Rivera Gets Beaned
summary: These days even the baseball Hall of Fame is politicized.. If modern leftism has an operating principle, it is that no aspect of life-not business, not religion, not even baseball-can be allowed to escape the orthodoxy police. Former New York Yankee ace Mariano Rivera is the latest to find this out.

title: Justice Drops Another Call
summary: Stringing out the Sprint-T-Mobile merger won't help competition.. Oops, another dropped call by government antitrust attorneys. Earlier this week news leaked that the Justice Department had finally agreed to approve the T-Mobile-Sprint merger after demanding its pound of flesh. Now Justice is reportedly negotiating the deal with states. Here we go again.

title: U.S., Afghanistan Agree on Need to Accelerate Peace Talks
summary: Secretary of State Pompeo offers President Ghani assurances after Trump's 'face of the Earth' remark. The U.S. and Afghanistan agreed this week to accelerate a peace process to end the 18-year war and continue existing U.S. policies aimed at reducing the American troop presence as conditions permit, the two countries said in a joint statement.

title: Photos from the Ebony and Jet Archives
summary: The consortium plans to donate the photo archives of Johnson Publishing to the Smithsonian and other cultural institutions. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: CFPB Announces $60 Million Fine Against Debt Collectors
summary: Consumer agency still cracking down despite slower pace of enforcement under Trump. WASHINGTON-The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau banned two debt collectors and fined them more than $60 million, extending a crackdown on abusive practices in a heavily scrutinized segment of the financial industry.

title: Beloved Manhattan Art Studio Draws to a Close
summary: Artist Minerva Durham hopes to find cheaper space to keep offering popular drawing classes, though real estate in New York is 'unreasonable'. When Minerva Durham describes the art classes she has taught for decades in New York City, she speaks of them in the most sacred terms.

title: Milley Confirmed by Senate as Head of Joint Chiefs
summary: Nation's top officer will serve as the principal military adviser to President Trump. Army Gen. Mark Milley was confirmed Thursday to serve as the next chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff in an 89-to-1 vote in the Senate.

title: Google Posts Strong Profits as Hazards Mount
summary: Alphabet, search giant's parent, charts 19% jump in quarterly revenue as regulatory scrutiny intensifies. Google became the latest technology titan to shake off new threats, delivering strong earnings ahead of looming regulatory peril.

title: Schwab to Buy USAA Investment Company Assets
summary: Firm moves further into wealth management as it expands beyond roots as discount broker. Charles Schwab Corp. said it would acquire assets of USAA's investment management company, including brokerage and managed-portfolio accounts, for $1.8 billion.

title: What Were Robespierre's Pronouns?
summary: The French Revolution was led by sociopaths who politicized language, much like today's Jacobins.. We often make historical parallels here. History doesn't repeat itself but it does rhyme, as clever people say. And sometimes it hiccups. Here is a hiccup.

title: The Five Men the Government Plans to Execute First
summary: Justice Department says it will resume federal executions. The Justice Department said it would resume federal executions, starting with five men who have been convicted of killing children. Here is a look at their cases.

title: Starbucks Boosts Sales With Help From New Drinks, Store Upgrades
summary: Coffee chain lifts quarterly earnings 26% and raises its profit forecast for the full year. Starbucks Corp. said sales rose in its key U.S. and China markets, thanks to new drinks and upgrades to its stores and digital-ordering platforms.

title: FEMA Says It Will Further Restrict Puerto Rico's Access to Relief Funds
summary: Secretary of Justice Wanda Vázquez also faces possible ethical probe, as she prepares to become governor. SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico-Federal mistrust toward Puerto Rico amid corruption allegations hasn't let up with the governor's resignation.

title: Is Jesus Good for the Jews?
summary: They're indifferent to Christian theology, but many claim him as one of their own.. Was Jesus a Jew? The idea shouldn't be controversial. Yet there have been plenty of attempts to challenge his connection to Judaism. Dissociating Jesus from his Jewishness has a dark history that continues to poison discourse today.

title: Chicago Betrays the Public Trust for Obama
summary: Meanwhile, the San Diego City Council arbitrarily stops the Bottini family from building on its land.. Politics often allow the strong to trample the weak. That's what happened in two land-use cases on which I am lead counsel. Superficially the cases have little in common, but they show how unfettered discretion lets cities block small projects that are sound and authorize large ones that are unwise.

title: What Mueller Was Trying to Hide
summary: His investigation was about protecting the actual miscreants in the collusion hoax.. Special counsel Robert Mueller testified before two House committees Wednesday, and his performance requires us to look at his investigation and report in a new light. We've been told it was solely about Russian electoral interference and obstruction of justice. It's now clear it was equally about protecting the actual miscreants behind the Russia-collusion hoax.

title: Federal Government Set to Resume Executions
summary: Attorney general tells Bureau of Prisons to schedule executions of five death-row inmates. WASHINGTON-The federal government will resume executing death-row inmates after a 16-year hiatus, Attorney General William Barr said Thursday, countering a national trend that has brought a decline in the application of capital punishment.

title: Bending the Law to Avoid Deporting Criminals
summary: One alien persuaded a judge to reduce a battery sentence he'd already served.. Federal law mandates deportation of aliens who are convicted of "aggravated felonies"-defined to include certain state misdemeanors carrying a sentence of a year or longer-whether or not they are in the country legally. But some judges, prosecutors and legislators are playing games to get around this law.

title: 'Becoming Superman' Review: A Life Saved By Storytelling
summary: The author marvels that he survived his abusive upbringing. He attributes his salvation to the superhero comics he discovered as a child.. Fantasy used to be seen as a childish thing to be set aside in adulthood. Yet in recent years the tide has turned decisively in its favor, thanks in part to J.K. Rowling's "Harry Potter" series, Peter Jackson's film adaptations of "The Lord of the Rings" and the cultural tsunami of "Game of Thrones." Imaginary worlds have become the equivalent of religion, providing meaning and wonder in a secular age. Fandom generates the rites and fellowship once associated with spiritual practice, and "story" has replaced "providence" as the master metaphor of our lives.

title: New York Unveils $58.4 Million Plan to Curb Cyclist Deaths
summary: Five-year Green Wave plan will combine urban design, law enforcement and education, Mayor de Blasio said. New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio on Thursday announced a new effort to improve bicycle safety after an uptick in cyclist deaths for 2019, including three deaths in just over a week this summer.

title: International Diplomacy Is Not Just Cricket
summary: Pakistan's prime minister won a world cup, but reviving relations with the U.S. will be a tall order.. Can Prime Minister Imran Khan resurrect U.S.-Pakistan ties the way he once rescued his country's fortunes in cricket? He seems to think so. After a successful three-day visit to Washington this week, Mr. Khan declared that he felt as if he had won the World Cup.

title: Counter Inequality With Private Social Security Accounts
summary: The current program yields about 1% a year, while the market can give retirees access to true wealth.. Democratic presidential candidates like Elizabeth Warren and Cory Booker have made inequality a central issue in the campaign. But their plans for minimum-wage hikes, wealth taxes and income-tax rates of 50% to 70% would restrain the economy and hurt all Americans. At least they have ideas. Republicans seem to have few of their own to boost the wealth of working- and middle-class people, ceding the debate to the Democrats and their ill designs.

title: Notable & Quotable: Prof. Warren on the School District Premium
summary: 'The public school system has failed middle-class families, especially anywhere near metropolitan areas.'. Prof. Elizabeth Warren on NPR, answering a question about why people end up in debt from "living in houses that are a lot bigger than they should be," Dec. 30, 2003:

title: Google, Amazon Had Different Bars to Clear
summary: Amazon disappoints against high expectations, while Google had nowhere to go but up. Google and Amazon.com , both internet behemoths, each face their own specific set of challenges. Only Google headed into its second quarter report with nowhere to go but up.

title: Intel Agrees to Sell Smartphone-Chip Assets to Apple
summary: The chip maker also reports lower profit and revenue. Intel Corp. on Thursday said it would sell a majority of its smartphone-modem chip business to Apple Inc. for $1 billion in a deal that both Silicon Valley giants hope will address weaknesses in their technology lineup.

title: Tesla Tech Chief Departs, Stock Slides After Earnings
summary: Shares fell after electric-auto maker reported bigger-than-expected second-quarter loss. Tesla Inc. shares suffered one of their biggest retreats since the company went public in 2010, in the wake of a disappointing quarterly earnings report and the announcement that the longtime chief technology officer who helped create the company is leaving.

title: Trump Administration Considers Travel Ban on Guatemala
summary: Trump earlier this week threatened to punish Guatemala over failed 'safe third country' deal; other options under consideration include action on remittances or tariffs. The Trump administration is considering imposing a travel ban on Guatemala after the country backed off plans to accept Central American asylum seekers, a White House official said, a move likely to face a court challenge if carried through.

title: Democratic Hopefuls Offer Muted Response to Mueller Testimony
summary: A majority of presidential candidates support impeachment proceedings against Trump, but other issues dominate with voters.

title: Jeffrey Epstein Burrowed Into the Lives of the Rich and Made a Fortune
summary: Resume Subscription. Jeffrey Epstein built a fortune of more than half a billion dollars leveraging unusually close relationships with a small group of rich and powerful individuals over four decades.

title: Senate Panel Urges More Work to Prevent Election Attacks
summary: In wake of 2016 interference by Russia, report recommends paper ballots, warns against online voting. WASHINGTON-The U.S. has made progress in securing its voting infrastructure after the Russian interference campaign in the 2016 presidential election, but more must be done to protect against future attacks, a Senate panel said in a report released on Thursday.

title: Mortgage Insurer MGIC Investment Promotes CFO to Top Job
summary: Promotions from the CFO to the chief executive position are on the rise at U.S. companies. MGIC Investment Corp. on Thursday elevated its finance chief to the role of chief executive, highlighting the mortgage insurer's preference for internal candidates in the top seat.

title: CFPB Could Curb High-Debt Mortgages
summary: Move could replace the provision with a tougher version of the regulation. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration plans to eliminate a regulatory loophole that put the government on the hook for an additional $260 billion of mortgages last year, a move that could limit the availability of credit for home loans.

title: Justice Department in Talks With States to Win Support for T-Mobile, Sprint Merger
summary: Federal officials seek support from state attorneys general in response to antitrust lawsuit to block transaction. The Justice Department is pushing state officials to support a planned settlement that would allow T-Mobile US Inc. and Sprint Corp. to merge by selling assets to Dish Network Corp. , according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Morgan Stanley Poaches UBS Health-Care Banker Jim Forbes
summary: Mr. Forbes to be a vice chairman at Morgan Stanley. Morgan Stanley has hired longtime health-care investment banker Jim Forbes away from UBS Group AG , as deal activity in the sector booms.

title: Can Anyone Make Peace With the Palestinians?
summary: Why should Israel or the U.S. believe the current Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas's position would change? If you can keep your four-year term for 14 years without improving the position of your people, why change your stance?. Raghida Dergham's "Trump Can't Make Peace by Wishing the Palestinians Away" (op-ed, July 18) is a study in conveniently ignoring facts. The Trump administration has made it clear it intends to offer a political solution as well as its economic one. The Palestinians were "no-shows" in multiple attempts at political solutions with economic incentives:

title: U.S. Equity Markets: Fair, Liquid and Clear
summary: Dark pools and off-exchange market makers use incentives too, and capture over one-third of all U.S. trading. Rebates help exchanges compete with these off-exchange, and less regulated, traders.. In "The SEC Wants to Give Public Investors a Fair Shot" (op-ed, July 19), Larry Harris presents a classically oversimplified view of U.S. equity markets. A more complete view of U.S. market structure shows that thanks to the competitiveness of the U.S. equity markets, incentives to attract liquidity are commonplace. Dark pools and off-exchange market makers use incentives too, and capture over one-third of all U.S. trading. Rebates help exchanges compete with these off-exchange, and less regulated, traders. The U.S. market is among the most transparent markets in the world-and recent regulatory changes have increased that transparency.

title: The Kavanaugh Circus Cost the Democrats a Senate Majority
summary: For the "inquisition"-like conduct of the three Democratic senators, Democrats across the country have to pay the price every day.. Mollie Hemingway and Carrie Severino do an exemplary public service effectively taking the Senate Judiciary Committee Democrats to task in their conduct of the Brett Kavanaugh Supreme Court hearings in late September of last year ("Kavanaugh Fight Was No 'Win,'" op-ed, July 15).

title: Costly Aluminum Beer Cans And Various Workarounds
summary: Molson Coors and other big U.S. aluminum-can users have an incentive to go into the aluminum can business or start using glass bottles again.. Pete Coors makes a good case in "Aluminum Suppliers Kick Our Cans" (op-ed, July 23) for Molson Coors and other U.S. aluminum-can users to go into the aluminum-can business, thereby giving Alcoa and other aluminum-can suppliers some well-deserved competition to the recent, tariff-induced "manipulative business practices that appear to permeate the industry." Either that, or start using glass bottles, which Coors used in former times. The more-premium beers for sale on the grocery shelves these days are in bottles, not cans.

title: Airline Shares Affected by Exposure to Boeing's 737 MAX
summary: Reports from Southwest and American send many airline stocks lower Thursday. The grounding of Boeing's 737 MAX fleet is continuing to have ripple effects in the air-travel industry.

title: 'The McMartin Family Trials' Review: Prosecution as Ludicrous Charade
summary: This haunting documentary revisits the case in the 1980s involving false charges of sex abuse against the owners and employees of a preschool in California.. Familiar though its facts may be, there's no sitting through "The McMartin Family Trials" (Saturday, 7 p.m., Oxygen) without a sense of enveloping darkness. This case-built on false charges of sex abuse, manufactured evidence, and the attention of a runaway press corps whose credulous legions wrote their hearts out reporting every fantastic charge-still has its haunting power 3 1/2 decades after it began in 1983. Not to mention a certain contemporary resonance. The ruin that befell the owners of the esteemed McMartin preschool in Manhattan Beach, Calif., and its mostly middle-aged female teachers had begun with a phone call. The caller claimed that her son had been molested by 25-year-old Ray Buckey, grandson of the school's founder, Virginia McMartin, age 76, who would soon also be accused.

title: 'Amazing Dogs' Review: Up and Down the Canine Family Tree
summary: A three-part documentary series on the Smithsonian Channel takes a detailed look at dog breeds around the world.. Despite its suggestive title, "Amazing Dogs" (Sunday, 8 p.m., Smithsonian Channel)-an extraordinarily inclusive series-doesn't actually expend much of its time on the kind of canines who share our homes, namely the domestic pet kind. This three-part series is largely concerned with the great breadth of the dog family tree, which takes us to breeds around the world, including a terrifying and not terribly well-known one known as the African hunting dog-canines, we're warned, who are natural killers with pointed teeth perfect for tearing through flesh. They have never lost their inner wildness, the narrator notes, so it's best never to let your guard down around them in case you were ever mad enough to come close to one of them. Among the large predators on the African plains, these dogs live in marauding mobs of 30, they can take down prey 10 times their size, and they don't actually resemble any pooch you're likely to run into on a leash.

title: Two Health-Tech Companies Join IPO Parade With Strong Debuts
summary: Livongo and Health Catalyst had priced their offerings above already-boosted projections. Livongo Health Inc. and Health Catalyst Inc., two rare health-technology firms joining the march of billion-dollar companies into the public markets, rallied in their trading debuts.

title: Library E-Book Lending Poses Rising Problem for Publishing Industry
summary: Macmillan will sell only one digital copy per library in first eight weeks of release. One of the country's largest book publishers is changing the way it sells e-books to libraries, whose increasingly popular digital-book borrowing apps are taking a toll on its sales.

title: Southwest Hastens Exit From Newark as MAX Grounding Effects Spread
summary: Boeing's biggest MAX customer flags capacity cuts, while American Airlines forecasts lower pretax earnings. Southwest Airlines Co. said the prolonged grounding of Boeing Co. 's 737 MAX hastened its decision to stop flying at New Jersey's Newark Liberty International Airport this fall, the latest carrier to flag capacity constraints and rising costs from operating without the popular aircraft.

title: Epstein Found Unconscious, Moved to Suicide-Watch Unit
summary: Financier awaits trial on sex-trafficking charges. Jeffrey Epstein was moved to a suicide-watch unit in a New York City detention center after the financier facing sex-trafficking charges was found unconscious in his cell Tuesday morning, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Democratic Candidates Sharpen Tone as Next Debates Approach
summary: Desperation grows for some fighting for survival in large field. WASHINGTON-Democratic presidential candidates are adopting a more combative tone on the campaign trail ahead of next week's debates in Detroit, laying out their disputes from afar as desperation grows for some of those fighting for survival.

title: Tesla Shares, Bonds Lose Steam
summary: Analysts said quarter highlighted carmaker's difficulty generating profits. Tesla Inc. shares and debt are facing fresh pressure as investors fear the company's growth is slowing sharply.

title: U.S. Stocks Fall After ECB Signals a Cut
summary: Investors fret the global-easing cycle is gaining momentum. U.S. stocks slid after the European Central Bank hinted it is preparing to cut interest rates for the first time since early 2016, a sign that the global easing cycle is gaining momentum.

title: Tarantino Movie Aims to Tap a Bygone Era-and Formula for Success
summary: 'Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood' is an expensive ode to 1960s Los Angeles, despite dwindling audiences for R-rated dramas in theaters. LOS ANGELES-Quentin Tarantino's new movie "Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood" will have to do a lot more than summon the sizzle of 1960s Los Angeles if it is going to buck recent moviegoing trends. It will have to defy a harsh box-office reality.

title: Reversal in Oil Stockpiles Helps Support Crude Prices
summary: Inventories slid more than 10 million barrels during week ended July 19 to lowest level since March. A slide in U.S. crude-oil stockpiles is adding to evidence that domestic supply growth could slow moving forward, an encouraging sign for bullish investors with prices still stuck in a tight range.

title: Recount Shows Melinda Katz Holding Lead in Queens Democratic Primary
summary: June 25 primary was too close to call; camp for other top contender, Cabán, sees victory after court hearing. Queens Borough President Melinda Katz held a slim lead over Tiffany Cabán in the Democratic primary for Queens district attorney after election officials Wednesday completed a manual recount of ballots, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Justice Ginsburg Kicks Buttigieg
summary: Are Democratic presidential candidates getting too radical for the Court's leading leftist?. The question hanging over the Democratic presidential debates in Miami last month was whether the extreme views expressed by the candidates might alienate moderate voters. But now even one of America's most celebrated leftists is expressing discomfort with the party's radical turn. Affectionately called "Notorious RBG" by liberals who admire her judicial activism, Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg is nonetheless compelled to defend judicial tradition.

title: 'Once Upon a Time...in Hollywood' Review: Lights! Action! Darkness!
summary: Quentin Tarantino's latest movie, set in 1969, is a violent, tender, funny paean to Tinseltown during the waning of film's golden age.. Quentin Tarantino's "Once Upon a Time...in Hollywood" excites you, delights you, lulls and seduces you in the spirit of its once-upon-a-time title. Come along, it seems to say, you may have guessed where we're going but we'll have fun and some surprises along the way. Then it astonishes you with a blast of terminal audacity. As one might expect from Mr. Tarantino's previous films, his new one is violent-extravagant violence is visited on men and women alike at several points-as well as tender, plus terrifically funny. Yet this virtuoso piece of storytelling also offers intricate instruction on the pervasiveness of violence in popular culture.

title: Pizza Quest: A Cross-Country Guide to the Best Pies
summary: America has regional pizza styles all its own, and each one has a fascinating story to tell. This summer, get out there and taste them for yourself. Here's your road map. Imagine a world before Pizza Hut, a time before Domino's and Papa John's homogenized our notions of what pizza can be. Over the last century, a patchwork of idiosyncratic styles emerged in family-owned pizzerias across the U.S., each one a history written in flour, tomatoes and cheese. I've made it my mission to sample them all.

title: 'Mike Wallace Is Here' Review: Interrogating the Interrogator
summary: Avi Belkin's documentary looks at the actor-turned-newsman whose commanding, confrontational interviews were central to '60 Minutes.'. As predictable as the ticking of the clock on "60 Minutes," Mike Wallace asked the toughest of the program's questions. He was the maestro of the gotcha moment-or "the master of nailing," as Stephen Colbert once described him. "Mike Wallace Is Here" doesn't answer tough questions about Wallace's career: Was it drama, good journalism or both? What was his legacy? But Avi Belkin's documentary offers fascinating insights into what made its subject tick.

title: USDA Sets Plans for $16 Billion in New Aid to Farmers
summary: Fresh support for agricultural sector follows stalled U.S.-China trade talks. The U.S. Department of Agriculture is preparing to deploy $16 billion in government funds to aid farmers hurt by the trade battle with China and wet weather that kept many from planting a crop this spring.

title: Government Bond Yields Rise After ECB Meeting
summary: Draghi says risk of recession in eurozone is 'pretty low' despite worsening economic outlook. Government bond yields in the U.S. and Europe rose Thursday after European Central Bank President Mario Draghi downplayed the risk of recession in the eurozone. The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note settled at 2.078%, compared with 2.052% Wednesday.

title: More Than 100 Migrants Believed Dead in Shipwreck Off Libya
summary: Incident is the deadliest this year in the Mediterranean Sea, where thousands have died attempting to reach Europe. More than 100 migrants are believed to have drowned in a shipwreck off the Libyan coast, the United Nations refugee agency said, the deadliest incident this year in the Mediterranean Sea, where thousands have died attempting to reach Europe.

title: Auto Makers Agree to Stricter California Tailpipe-Emissions Standards
summary: Trump administration decries agreement with car makers, says U.S. should set rules. The White House is pushing back on a new agreement between California and a handful of car companies on fuel-economy standards, potentially deepening a regulatory rift between the Trump administration and the nation's most populous state.

title: The Tour de France's High-Altitude Poker Game
summary: In the race's decisive climbs, riders study each other constantly in search of weakness-or a bluff. SAINT-MICHEL-DE-MAURIENNE, France-All the way up the hardest climb of Thursday's Tour de France stage, the favorites rode nearly shoulder-to-shoulder. They looked around at each other, the same men they race against all season, and searched for something they rarely see: any sign of weakness.

title: How Ransomware Attacks Are Forcing Big Payments From Cities, Counties
summary: Wielding malware called Ryuk, hackers make more targeted attacks. Somewhere, likely far from U.S. shores, cybercriminals are reaping handsome rewards by wielding malicious software called Ryuk to attack places as random as LaPorte County, Ind., and Lake City, Fla.

title: Temperatures Soar to Record Highs in Europe
summary: Resume Subscription. Temperatures hit record highs in Europe on Thursday, as people from the U.K. to Germany looked for ways to cool off and the mercury climbed into the 100s.

summary: A living museum of 1960s Mexican modernism. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

MEXICO CITY-Mexico's murder rate hit a record last year, and homicides continue to climb so far this year, posing a challenge for the new government of President Andrés Manuel López Obrador.

title: Hong Kong Police Block March Protesting Mob Attack
summary: Ban comes amid fears demonstration could ignite further violence in district where mob injured 45 people. HONG KONG-Police blocked a protest planned for this weekend in a district where a mob attacked protesters on Sunday, raising the prospect for further clashes as some activists promised to go despite the ban.

title: ECB Signals Rate Cut, Possible Asset Purchases
summary: Central bank is examining a return to asset purchases, a major policy shift. FRANKFURT-The European Central Bank signaled Thursday that it is preparing to cut short-term interest rates for the first time since 2016 and restart a giant bond-buying program, in a significant policy shift that aims to insulate the wobbling eurozone economy from global headwinds ranging from trade tensions to Brexit.

title: Boeing Drops Out of Giant Pentagon Program to Replace Nuclear Missiles
summary: Move would leave Northrop Grumman as the sole bidder for the first phase of the $60 billion program; Company cites concerns with procurement process. Boeing Co. said it won't bid for a huge Pentagon contract to replace the nation's land-based nuclear missiles, just a day after Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg touted the aerospace giant's suitability for the job.

title: Budweiser Maker Loses More Ground in U.S.
summary: Quarterly profit rises on strength in Brazil, its second-largest market, despite loss of market share among American drinkers. Anheuser-Busch InBev NV sold more beer at higher prices globally in the second quarter, but its struggles persisted in the U.S. where drinkers are still defecting from its flagship Budweiser and Bud Light brands.

title: Hershey to Raise Chocolate Bar Prices
summary: Candy maker, which reported higher-than-expected profit, is increasing prices 9% next year. Hershey Co. is raising prices on chocolate bars and other wrapped candies, the first increase the company has implemented on some of its signature products in more than five years.

title: The Key to Boris Johnson's Brexit Plan Is Held by Dublin
summary: British leader faces a game of chicken with Ireland and the EU that could trigger a messy split that all sides say they would rather avoid. LONDON-For Boris Johnson, the road to a smooth and orderly Brexit runs straight through Dublin.

title: iRobot's Giant Sucking Sound
summary: Roomba maker hit by tariffs just as it launches new $1,000 vacuum.

title: Europe Logs Record Heat, Struggles to Conserve Water
summary: Facing high temperatures and drought, the continent is scorched again, sparking rare water emergency. SAINT-RÉMY, France-Temperatures hit record highs in Europe on Thursday, worsening a yearslong drought that has triggered a rare water emergency across the continent-parching crops, sapping rivers and forcing governments from Spain to the Netherlands to enact conservation measures.

title: Homeownership Rate Slipped in Second Quarter
summary: Soft ownership numbers signal that low mortgage rates and low unemployment are failing to lure enough buyers to market. The U.S. homeownership rate fell for a second straight quarter, as high prices and limited starter-home inventory are steering more households toward renting.

title: Markets Hope ECB Easing Package Could Be a Big One
summary: Investors bet change in Mario Draghi's language on inflation could indicate aggressive measures to come in September. The European Central Bank sent a strong signal Thursday that a package of easing measures is coming in September. Recent emphasis from President Mario Draghi that the central bank would tolerate higher inflation has some investors betting the effort is going to be aggressive.

title: Amazon's New York Office Hunt Includes Lord & Taylor Building
summary: E-commerce giant seeking to continue expanding across city after abandoning HQ2 plans in Queens. Amazon.com Inc. is scouring New York City for new office space, including the historic building that formerly housed Lord & Taylor's flagship store, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Draghi's Last Stimulus
summary: The European Central Bank chief eases the path for his successor.. Mario Draghi signaled Thursday that he won't be idle in his last months leading the European Central Bank. His gift to successor Christine Lagarde is likely to be a reduction in eurozone interest rates in September and a reboot of asset purchases known as quantitative easing.

title: Warren Kanders Resigns From Whitney Museum's Board
summary: Artists and museum staff have protested over his company's military products seen at the U.S.-Mexico border. A vice chairman of the board of the Whitney Museum of American Art resigned Thursday after months of artists' protests over his company's military products, including canisters used to hold tear gas.

title: Should Instagram Get Rid of 'Likes'?
summary: The popular platform is threatening to stop tallying hearts, which might improve users' mental health-but thwart influencers and rob the platform of its essential quality. We argue both sides of the debate. TOYING WITH emotions is nothing new for social-media giants: In 2015 Facebook let users react with "laughter" and "anger" emojis to posts, rather than relying solely on its iconic Thumbs-Up. That same year, Twitter swapped the star that marked "Favorites" for a sentimental heart.

title: KKR's Earnings Fall; Assets Rise
summary: Firm reported $522.7 million in earnings, down 24% from the year-ago period. KKR & Co. 's earnings declined in the second quarter, but the portion of earnings that could be returned to shareholders exceeded Wall Street's expectations.

title: Get Off My Lawn! Homeowners Ward Off Drivers Misled by GPS
summary: People on the receiving end of addled smartphone navigation deal with the lost; 'Somebody backed into our mailboxes'. Everett Ogden's dream house was a three-bedroom at the end of a quiet dead-end road along a river in Jacksonville, Fla.

title: Need to Relocate? Bring the House, Too
summary: Faced with coastal erosion, these homeowners on Nantucket had two options: tear down their 10,000-square-foot home, or pick it up and move it. Dao Engle, some neighbors and a handful of local kite-boarders stood on a sand dune on Pocomo Head along Nantucket Harbor this past June and watched nervously as her 10,000 square-foot home, which had been separated from its foundation and placed on a series of steel moving rails, began its very slow, very short trip to safety.

title: Prosecutors Back Barr's Call for Access to Encrypted Devices
summary: U.S. attorneys from New York say law-enforcement authorities need access to encrypted communications to catch criminals. NEW YORK-Federal prosecutors added their support Wednesday to a call from the U.S. attorney general for technology companies to allow law-enforcement agencies access to encrypted communications. They said privacy advocates misinterpret the issue.

summary: U.S. Treasury Department's securities sales next week are divided between 13- and 26-week bills. The U.S. will auction $72 billion in securities next week. Details (all with minimum denominations of $100):

title: How to Move a House in One Piece
summary: A project manager breaks down the process behind relocating a house. Founded in 1927, large-scale masonry and steel engineering firm International Chimney has been party to many of the most significant structural moves in the United States. Project manager Tyler Finkle breaks down how a big house gets moving.

title: 3M Cuts Costs as Industrial Demand Cools
summary: Conglomerate aims to focus on fast-growing sectors such as health, beats earnings expectations. 3M Co. posted improved quarterly sales in some core divisions but said demand from China and major industrial customers remains weak, underscoring challenges that weaker trade is creating for many big U.S. manufacturers.

title: Deliciousness Is What Matters Most
summary: Food of the future may need to be more sustainable, nutritious and biodiverse-but none of that will appeal if it doesn't taste good. In the modern world, you can tie yourself in knots deciding what to eat. Is this food ethical enough? Is it high in protein? Local? With so many competing voices shouting in your head, you could almost forget to check whether the darned thing tastes any good.

title: Comcast's Profit Falls on Sky Costs, Erosion of Pay-TV Business
summary: Cable giant posts strong growth in internet, mobile segments. Comcast Corp. posted a slightly lower profit as strong growth at its internet and mobile business was offset by costs related to the acquisition of European pay-television provider Sky PLC and the continuing erosion of its pay-TV customer base.

title: For Airlines, the Devil Is in the 737 MAX Detail
summary: Southwest Airlines is assuming the troubled jet flies in 2020, whereas American is factoring in flights in November. In today's aviation industry, headline profit numbers have become less important than assumptions about when the Boeing 737 MAX jet will fly again.

title: 4 Outdoor Adventures for Night Owls
summary: For travelers who like desert hikes or snorkeling with manta rays, these outdoor excursions get going well after the sun goes down. Ex-Marine Bruce Leadbetter, owner of 360 Adventures, leads private evening hikes through the Sonoran Desert at McDowell Mountain Regional Park, just outside Scottsdale, Ariz. Highlights of the 2½ hour hike include sightings of blinky owls, furtive foxes, moonlit mesas and, if you're lucky, meteor showers. Even without one, the starry desert sky rarely disappoints. From $75 per person for 2 to 3 people, 360-adventures.com

title: Turkey Slashes Rates in Dash for Growth
summary: New central bank governor returns Turkey to an expansive policy despite persistent selling pressure on the lira. A larger-than-expected interest rate cut in Turkey is stirring concern that President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is whittling away the independence of the country's central bank in his bid to crank up the economy and arrest a slump in popular support.

title: Amtrak to Offer Nonstop Trains Between New York and Washington
summary: Route is early test of plans to offer more service on business-class Acela trains. Amtrak will begin running limited nonstop Acela trains between Washington and New York in September, an early test of plans to offer more frequent service on its business-class line when a new fleet of trains arrive in 2021.

title: Prospective Fed Nominee Judy Shelton Resigned From EBRD Job
summary: Ms. Shelton cited her pending Fed nomination as the reason for her resignation from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development. WASHINGTON-One of President Trump's latest picks for the Federal Reserve Board, economic commentator Judy Shelton, has resigned from her post as U.S. envoy to the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, the bank said Wednesday.

title: The Fun of Having Our Gadgets Spy on Us
summary: Never mind the privacy issues-think of the possible benefits!. Last week, Apple disabled the Walkie-Talkie app on its line of watches after discovering a security flaw that could allow a person to eavesdrop on another person's iPhone conversation. Almost simultaneously, Google admitted that it employs a small army of people to listen in on conversations between consumers and their digital assistants. This follows the revelation last year by Amazon that one of its Echo speakers recorded a private conversation and then sent it to one of the people on the owner's contact list.

title: Republicans Stand Firm on Mueller Investigation
summary: Democrats ponder whether Mueller's testimony changes their political calculus on impeachment, but the hearings didn't sway Republicans. This item first appeared in the Capital Journal newsletter. Read today's full newsletter here or sign up here for daily updates in your inbox.

title: U.S. Durable Goods Orders Rose in June
summary: New aircraft orders bounced back. Demand for long-lasting goods produced in U.S. factories rose in June after two straight months of declines, driven by new orders for transportation goods, particularly civilian aircraft.

title: Nissan to Cut 12,500 Jobs as Profit Sinks
summary: Eight months after Ghosn's arrest, company struggles to turn corner as festering problems in the U.S. worsen. YOKOHAMA, Japan- Nissan Motor Co. said it would cut 12,500 jobs, or 9% of its global workforce, after reporting an implosion in profit in the latest quarter that stemmed in large part from the U.S.

title: Don't Waste a Good Automotive Crisis
summary: Car makers recovering from profound problems, like Ford, Peugeot and VW, are among those that have performed best this year. Results from the world's largest car maker are no guide to events in the global auto industry, but they do highlight how investors should approach it. Crisis, if properly exploited, will be where opportunity lies in a deteriorating industry environment.

title: Boris Johnson Talks Tough on Brexit in Combative First Speech
summary: New prime minister's approach looks set to put the U.K. on a collision course with the European Union. LONDON-British Prime Minister Boris Johnson laid out a hard-line negotiating stance with the European Union, setting the stage for fraught Brexit talks before the U.K.'s scheduled departure from the bloc on Oct. 31.

title: Tunisia's First Democratically Elected President Has Died
summary: Beji Caid Essebsi played a major role in shaping Tunisia's future after the 2010-2011 revolution. Tunisia's President Beji Caid Essebsi, the country's first freely elected leader, died Thursday after leading the only democracy to emerge from the Arab Spring uprisings.

title: Making a Big Picture From Small Pieces
summary: Maps, computer programs and mathematical proofs all create intricate wholes by joining many simple parts.. In the age of space flight, we are used to seeing photographs of the Earth that reveal it as a nearly spherical blue ball. But there was a time in history when reasonable people agreed that the Earth was flat, and I have mathematical sympathy for them-because it does look flat if you only see the area immediately around you. You can take a small flat map of your local area and stick it to a neighboring map, and then one neighboring that, and so on, to make a larger map of the city or the whole country. If you keep going, you will end up with a flat map of the Earth.

title: VW Bucks Industry Trend With Strong Earnings
summary: The performance of VW's passenger cars and sports car maker Porsche helped offset weaker performance at Audi. BERLIN- Volkswagen AG bucked the downward trend in the global auto industry, reporting robust second-quarter earnings on strong sales expansion of its higher priced sport-utility vehicles.

title: Household Brands Get a Brief Taste of Their Heyday
summary: Sales at Diageo, Unilever and AB InBev have been boosted by particularly strong demand in emerging markets. Emerging markets have been an important source of growth to global consumer giants for some time. For certain names, though, sales in these regions are growing at rates not seen for up to six years. A breather from currency and political volatility, rather than a pickup in underlying economic growth, is the likely cause.

summary: The island needs leaders who will work with the federal control board.. title: U.S. Jobless Claims Decreased Last Week
summary: Initial claims, a measure of how many workers were laid off across the U.S., fell last week for third time in four weeks. WASHINGTON-The number of Americans applying for first-time unemployment benefits fell last week for the third time in four weeks, a sign of a firm labor market.

title: U.S. Sanctions Compliance Fines Hit Decade High
summary: A surge in penalties reflects a broadening range of sanctions affecting a wider swath of industries, lawyers say. Fines issued by the U.S. regulator enforcing sanctions compliance have hit a decade high at a time when the Trump administration is increasingly using sanctions as a foreign policy tool.

title: Investors Pour Money Into Bond Funds at a Record Pace
summary: About $455 billion is expected to flow into bond funds in 2019, a sign investors remain cautious. Investors are piling into safe-haven bonds at a record pace, a sign that caution remains despite stocks pushing toward records.

title: After Tyreek Hill Scandal, the NFL Still Has No Answer for Off-the-Field Issues
summary: With a pair of investigations in the last year, the Kansas City Chiefs have become a case study in the troubling calculations teams have to make when players are accused of wrongdoing. The Kansas City Chiefs suspended star receiver Tyreek Hill last April when-in the midst of an investigation into injuries sustained by his 3-year-old son-a disturbing audiotape emerged in which his then-fiancée is heard saying their son was terrified of him.

title: Plan to Save Truckers' and Miners' Pensions Is Running Out of Time
summary: House approves $48.5 billion package offering forgivable loans to the most troubled multiemployer pension funds. U.S. senators are gearing up for a battle over how to fix the pensions of about 1.3 million retirees and workers in trucking, mining and other industries.

summary: Spat could threaten availability of Apple's iPhones, Amazon's cloud-computing data servers and the inventory of many internet-connected gadgets. title: Higher Fed Inflation Target Before Recession Would Have Led to Faster Recovery, Economists Find
summary: Paper suggests that higher inflation target would lead to higher interest rates, giving central bankers greater ability to fight future downturns. WASHINGTON-A higher Federal Reserve inflation target ahead of the 2007-09 recession likely would have given the central bank more room to lower interest rates and resulted in a "substantially" faster economic recovery, a group of economists has found.

title: Stoke the Base or Woo Swing Voters? Campaigns Weigh Benefits
summary: In a polarized nation, most Americans are committed to one party but persuadable voters represent 15% or 20% of electorate. Most U.S. voters have hardened opinions about President Trump. title: Ice-Cream Wars Hit Unilever Sales
summary: Sales of ice cream are hit by cool weather in Europe and a tough trading environment in the U.S.. LONDON-Unilever PLC missed sales forecasts in the first half of the year as cool weather and intense competition hit ice cream sales in Europe and North America.

title: Crypto Promoter Apologizes After Postponing Warren Buffett Lunch
summary: The crypto entrepreneur's abrupt decision-attributed to a health issue-to put off the meeting originally set for this week has raised eyebrows. Cryptocurrency investor and entrepreneur Justin Sun apologized on Chinese social media for what he described as "excessive self promotion," after a tumultuous few days following his postponement of a charity lunch with Warren Buffett this week.

title: Roche Sales Boosted by New Drug Pipeline
summary: Swiss health-care giant looks beyond cancer medicines as sales of newer drugs rise. Roche Holding AG lifted its outlook for the year as strong sales of its newer medicines blunted the impact of emerging generic competition to several of its top-selling cancer drugs.

title: North Korea Fires Two Short-Range Missiles Off Its East Coast
summary: Test coincides with a visit to Seoul by national security adviser John Bolton. SEOUL-North Korea launched two short-range missiles off the country's east coast early Thursday, South Korean officials said, as Pyongyang ratchets up pressure on Washington amid stalled nuclear talks.

title: Puerto Rico's Governor to Resign After Weeks of Public Outcry
summary: Gov. Rosselló steps down after large-scale protests-first-ever resignation of island's sitting governor. SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico-Puerto Rico Gov. summary: Company says it has resolved structural flaws that had led the company to delay the phone's release. SEOUL-Samsung Electronics Co. will start selling its foldable-screen smartphone by September, following a delayed rollout earlier this year after tech reviewers found structural flaws.

summary: Livongo Health and Health Catalyst are scheduled to begin trading on public markets this week. The public offerings of two digital health companies this week will test the market's attitude toward the sector following a three-year hiatus.

title: Trump Vetoes Resolutions Seeking to Block Arms Sales to Gulf Allies
summary: President says limiting arm sales to Saudi Arabia, U.A.E. would harm efforts to end Yemen war. WASHINGTON-President Trump vetoed joint resolutions from Congress that sought to block arms sales to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, calling them an ill-conceived effort to undermine important global partnerships.

title: Facebook Penalty Sends Message to Big Tech
summary: $5 billion fine alerts industry to greater liabilities for privacy missteps as some policy makers call for tougher oversight. WASHINGTON-The record $5 billion fine and oversight conditions federal regulators imposed on Facebook Inc. for privacy violations put Big Tech on notice that any company failing to protect consumer information may now face greater legal risks than previously.

title: PG&E, California Governor Win Two-Week Reprieve From Creditor Attacks
summary: The judge overseeing PG&E's bankruptcy gave the company until next month to devise a procedure for evaluating restructuring proposals. The judge presiding over PG&E Corp.'s bankruptcy declined to end the utility's exclusive control over the proceedings, instead granting California Gov. Gavin Newsom's administration time to try to avoid a free-for-all among competing restructuring strategies.
